repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: `nvim_win_set_config` may crash when attempting to move `curwin` to a
different tabpage if there is no other non-float available to switch to.

Solution: fix the crash. Fix `ONE_WINDOW` checks in `winframe_find_altwin` and
`win_altframe` to consider floating windows by instead using `one_window`. Allow
`one_window` to consider non-current tabpages. We can use `one_window` in
`win_close_othertab` now to also better reflect its use in `win_close`.

comment_data.body: Rather than a silent failure, make this error with something like `Failed to switch away from window %d` below. (Actually maybe this should be an `assert` if handling `Cannot move last window` instead)
Not what I meant; the crash _is_ possible, but if we check that this is the last non-float window here, this shouldn't ever be `NULL`.

It can be:

> Add a test that triggers win_goto(NULL) by attempting to move curwin to a different tabpage when it's the only window.
I get `Can not move last win` ðŸ¤”

```vim
let w = win_getid()
tabnew
call nvim_win_set_config(0, #{win: w, split: 'left'})
```
Thanks. I see a few other things and an issue in `winframe_find_altwin` anyway; I'll push some fixes in a bit...
I remember you said the more you read here, the more issues youâ€™ll find ðŸ˜‚. So youâ€™ve discovered another one.

This (and the same below) should probably be checking the tabpage of the window instead?

Better fixed in Vim first anyway; I'm instead preserving the current behaviour here and also checking `win != NULL`, which the clang static analysis job caught after I annotated `one_window` with `FUNC_ATTR_NONNULL_ARG`.

title: fix(api): crash when moving curwin to other tabpage
